DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Indicator of patient inevaluability for non-hematologic dose limiting toxicity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Negation Hematologic Dose-Limiting Toxicity Unevaluable Evaluation
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.:Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.:Unable to be evaluated.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.
